meanings.definition: A breed of dog known for its distinctive ridge of hair along its back.
meanings.sent1: Ridgebacks are loyal and protective companions.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of ridgebacks playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The ridgebacks wagged their tails happily as they chased a ball.
meanings.sent4: The ridgebacks stood proudly, their ridges glistening in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The ridgebacks' ridge makes them easily recognizable among other breeds.

meanings.definition: The act of raising or forming a ridge.
meanings.sent1: The ridgebacks of the roof help water flow down smoothly.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the workers began the ridgebacks of the damaged road.
meanings.sent3: The ridgebacks of the sandcastle made it look like a mini mountain.
meanings.sent4: The ridgebacks of the bookshelf kept the books neatly organized.
meanings.sent5: The ridgebacks of the fence prevented the wind from knocking it down.

meanings.definition: A line or raised strip of land.
meanings.sent1: The ridgebacks in the field marked the boundary of the farm.
meanings.sent2: We hiked along the ridgebacks of the mountain to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent3: The ridgebacks of the garden helped separate the flowers from the vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The ridgebacks of the desert shimmered in the heat of the day.
meanings.sent5: The ridgebacks of the riverbank provided a natural barrier for the water.
